title: How to Choose Parsnips

steps.headline: Look for parsnips that are very white.
steps.description: The whiter the flesh, the sweeter the parsnip.

steps.headline: Choose firm parsnips with intact roots.
Avoid parsnips that are yellowing or going brown around the core.
steps.description: These are likely to be older and therefore less sweet.

steps.headline: Avoid buying parsnips that are shrivelled.
steps.description: Again, these are likely to be older and less sweet. Larger ones are more likely to have a woodier texture.

steps.headline: Prefer smaller parsnips over larger ones.
steps.description: These are generally sweeter and less woody. Taunton Fine Cooking, Choose Firm, Heavy Parsnips</ref>

text: Look for parsnips that are very white. The whiter the flesh, the sweeter the parsnip. Choose firm parsnips with intact roots.  Avoid parsnips that are yellowing or going brown around the core. These are likely to be older and therefore less sweet. Avoid buying parsnips that are shrivelled. Again, these are likely to be older and less sweet. Larger ones are more likely to have a woodier texture. Prefer smaller parsnips over larger ones. These are generally sweeter and less woody. Taunton Fine Cooking, Choose Firm, Heavy Parsnips</ref> Finished.
